何不食肉糜.definition: lit. "Why don't they eat meat?" (said by Emperor Hui of Jin 晉惠帝|晋惠帝[Jin4 Hui4 di4] when told that his people didn't have enough rice to eat); fig. (of people from higher class etc) to be oblivious to other people's plight

何其.definition: (literary) (similar to 多麼|多么[duo1 me5], used before an adjective in exclamations) how (fortunate etc); so (many etc)

何出此言.definition: where do these words stem from?; why do you (he, etc) say such a thing?

何厚鏵.definition: He Houhua (1955-), Macau financier and politician, Chief Executive 1999-2009

何去何從.definition: what course to follow; what path to take

何啻.definition: (literary) far more than; not limited to

何嘗.definition: (rhetorical question) when?; how?; it's not that...

何妨.definition: what harm is there in (doing sth)

何必.definition: there is no need; why should

何曾.definition: did I ever ...? (or "did he ever ...?" etc)

何樂不為.definition: (idiom) what is there against it? (rhetorical question indicating an eagerness or willingness to do sth)

何樂而不為.definition: what is there against it? (rhetorical question indicating an eagerness or willingness to do sth)

何況.definition: let alone; to say nothing of; besides; what's more

何苦.definition: why bother?; is it worth the trouble?

何謂.definition: (literary) what is?; what is the meaning of?

何須.definition: there is no need; why should
